data.title: Fixed bug in EarClippingTriangulator where vertex offset is ignored when computing triangles
data.body:
Bug: When vertices array describes multiple polygons then only first polygon is triangulated correctly; offset of all following polygons is ignored and function returns random triangles.

Fix:
1) Added offset when initializing indices
2) Added offset when computing winding

data.body: Added id as a property since Tiled recently added unique IDs to objects. Closes #2873.

data.title: Added FilehandleResolver for classpaths
data.body:
Case: The resolver will be useful for libraries that use Libgdx as a backend and have default assets packed in the library in case a desired asset can't be found to draw/play/etc. 

The InternalFileHandleResolver does not suffice, as it prioritizes looking in the internal storage first. From the documentation: "If a file can't be found on the internal storage, the file module falls back to searching the file on the classpath". In my case ClasspathFileHandleResolver will be used because we do not want to potentially use assets with the same name that the user has placed in the assets folder. 

Example: Have a "Missing texture" texture drawn when developer using my library want to draw a texture from a filehandle that does not exist. The "Missing texture" could in this case be located at MissingTexture.png in the classpath. If the developer using the library already has a MissingTexture.png file in internal storage, that one would be used instead if we resolve the file using InternalFileHandleResolver. We don't want the developer using my library have to know by heart file names that have to be avoided.

- added getTextureRegionAtIndex(int i)
- added restartAnimation()
- added setFrame(int f)

To keep the lightweight method for rendering/updating the AnimatedMapTiles, I use a timeOffset to move inside the different animation frames. I would highly appreciate any kind of criticism on this, through I don't think this is the best method, but can't find a different, better one.

data.title: changing the loopduration
data.body: Whoops, this is very important to correctly determine the frame.

data.title: Fix conditional packing  for issue #2883
data.body:
Augmented the **TexturePacker.isModified** method with the inclusion of a **TexturePacker.Settings** instance reference, which allows to retrieve the currently configured extension string for the atlas files.

Changed both overloads of the method **TexturePacker.processIfModified** to reflect that change (defaulting to the standard settings if none are passed by the user).

With this change the input string (raw assets folder to pack) will be checked against the generated atlas file that the packer produces. If a change is detected between the **last modified date** of the raw assets folder and the current (if existing) atlas file, the packing process should be triggered.

data.title: Sort keys in preferences [desktop]
data.body:
I've got quite a few entries in my preferences and sometimes I need to manually edit them (desktop only) for testing purposes. It seems like they're stored in a hashmap and thus not ordered which results in a total mess. I've got a few entries for gamepads, all starting with "controller..." and it'd be nice to see them in order.
I guess this isn't a difficult change since all that has to be done is using an ordered hashmap. Would be nice to have.

data.title: Mixup in IOSDevice
data.body:
I believe there is a mixup in the IOSDevice enum (backends/gdx-backend-robovm/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosrobovm/IOSDevice.java).  The ppi for iPhone 6 and iPhone 6+ are reversed.  The code currently reads:

```
IPHONE_6_PLUS("iPhone7,1", 326),
IPHONE_6("iPhone7,2", 401),
```

The 326 should say 401 and the 401 should say 326.

Regards,

Josh

data.title: Add spotlight support in Environment
data.body:
Hello,
This is my first Pull Request.
This Pull Request add support of spotlight in environment. It doesn't modify the shader so spotlight can't be used with default shader. But it allows to use spotlight in custom shader.

data.title: IOSSound preloading leaks memory on iOS client
TextField blink and non continuous rendering.
data.body:
Should the TextField's cursor blink with non continuous rendering?

I've realised that requestRendering() isn't called when the cursor is suposed to blink, is this the desired behavior?

(I guess that the same behavior is happening with TextAreas)

data.title: Hiero exports wrong base value
data.body:
When a font is exported/created using Hiero, and a padding has been set, the vertical offset is wrong. I noticed that this can be fixed by adding the half of the top/bottom padding to the exported base value of the .fnt file.

When I export a font using a top and bottom padding of top, bottom(6,6) and the spacing set to x,y(-12, -12)

The resulting .fnt looks like this:
`info face="Lato Regular" size=16 bold=0 italic=0 charset="" unicode=0 stretchH=100 smooth=1 aa=1    padding=6,6,6,6 spacing=-12,-12
    common lineHeight=22 base=16 scaleW=512 scaleH=512 pages=1 packed=0`

This leads to a font which is rendered just a little bit lower than the expected base line.
Changing the base value to 22 in this case fixes the issue. Actually I don't know if this is just by accident correct, but it definitely looks like that the base value if not correctly calculated.

data.title: OutOfMemoryError in ObjectSet<String>
Fix stuff in SuperKoalio
DragAndDrop not working if DragActor is the Source Actor
ParticleEmitter copy constructor does not copy premultiplied alpha attribute
data.body:
I discovered this while trying to use a ParticleEffect that has ParticleEmitters with premultiplied alpha with a ParticleEffectPool.

Not sure why the comment "Backwards compatibility" is used in reference to loading premultiplied alpha state in the `load (BufferedReader reader)`. Is premultiplied alpha not really supported? Premultiplied alpha is super helpful for particle effects. It opens up a lot of possibilities that alpha blending and additive blending don't offer.

data.title: ShapeRenderer: allow use of custom shader
data.body: Already implemented by ImmediateModeRenderer20, just not exposed through the ShapeRenderer API.

data.title: Lwjgl30 override EXTFramebufferObject usage
data.body: Separated from #2897. Overrides all uses of EXTFramebufferObject with the GL3 core functions.

data.title: Lwjgl30 override EXTFramebufferObject usage
data.body:
I'm doing some experiments with multi-target rendering (G-Buffers), for now using the gl32core branch by @nelsonsilva. I'm doing a separate PR because the changes are independent of this pending work.
- Overrides all uses of EXTFramebufferObject with the GL3 core functions.
- The second, small change is a new Texture() constructor which takes an existing GL handle. I'm using this to easily pass G-Buffer textures to Batch.draw() for debugging.
